sn23.12:1: At Sāvatthī. Sitting to one side, the Venerable Radha said to the Blessed One: "Venerable sir, it is said, ‘subject to Māra, subject to Māra.’[n.248]Māradhamma.Spkglosses withmaraṇadhamma,"subject to death." In some of the suttas that follow (namely, in relation to impermanence, suffering, and nonself), I translate the suffix-dhammaas "nature" rather than "subject to."What now, venerable sir, is subject to Māra?"
